text.p: Vical Inc said it sold an exclusive license to Genzyme Corp for its cytofectins gene therapy for the potential treatment of cystic fibrosis.
Vical was paid $1 million and may qualify for future milestone and royalty payments depending on the success of the compound in treating cystic fibrosis.

Cytofectins are synthetic substances used to incorporate genes into a substance that can be delivered into cells. Vical has developed a procedure to use the cytofectins to deliver a gene believed to correct the defect that causes cystic fibrosis. The procedure is currently being tested in animals.

Cystic fibrosis is a genetic disease caused by a defect in the function of a specific protein. People afflicted with the disease suffer from mucus buildup in the lungs, and related infections and respiratory problems.
The disease occurs in about one of every 2,500 births.
